I want you to be my own wife, and with the love and affection I have for you, I have the good intention of creating some property in your name without taking any reward from you, but love itself is gratuitous, and I have been granted the following schedule as a certificate of inheritance by my father, Venkatagirikota Mandal Tahsildar Gari P.V.662/
2025, and I have the full right of possession of the property in the amount of Rs.1,56,000/- (One Lakh Fifty Six Thousand Rupees in words) I have given you the land free of charge by way of settlement and have made it your possession this day, and you and your heirs shall enjoy it with all rights and privileges in perpetuity, subject to donation, sale, lease and transfer, from this date onwards, and you shall have full rights and duties in respect of the land as per Schedule, and neither I nor my heirs nor any other person shall have any right or interest in it, and I have no objection to the transfer of the land as per Schedule in your name in the Panchayat records, and there are no disputes whatsoever regarding the land as per Schedule, and this is the 1 Gopala settlement deed given to me free of charge with my consent and with my consent. SHCIL
SHCIL GG 0025288087

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 435 of 2026, dated 23-Jan-2026, executed by V. Gopal, in favour of his Wife, V. Chinnapapa, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 155.55 Sq.Yds, comprised in survey number 179/4A/1, situated in Raghavapalli Village, Thotakanuma Revenue Village & Grama Panchayat, Venakatagirikota Mandal, within the District of Chittoor, registered at sub-registrar office Palamaner, is bounded as follows: North by: Land of Usman Sab South by: Site of Yallamma East by: House of Sankarappa West by: Road Note :Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note : It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
